title: Lupita Nyong'o and Winnie Harlow look glamorous at the 13th annual Golden Heart Awards
text:
Monday night's Golden Heart Awards honored leading public figures for their public service and volunteer efforts.

The elite gathering was attended by a bevy of celebrities and tastemakers, including actress Lupita Nyong'o, 36, who looked effortlessly chic in a short pinstriped romper.

Also slaying at the event was model Winnie Harlow, 25, who sizzled in a purple sequined dress.

Stylish looks: Lupita Nyong'o, 36, and Winnie Harlow, 25, were among the glamorous faces at the 13th annual Golden Heart Awards Monday in New York City, which honors public service and volunteer efforts

Lupita was dressed in an haute couture romper styled like a double-breasted suit.

The gray–blue outfit featured extremely wide peaked lapels and was covered in glowing pinstripes comprised of small golden studs.

The short outfit showcased the Us star's fit legs, and she highlighted her hourglass figure with a matching leather belt cinched around her waist.

The 5ft5in Mexican-born actress had her raven tresses styled naturally and accessorized with a thick gold chain dangling from her belt.

Chic: Lupita was dressed in an haute couture romper styled like a double-breasted suit

Unmissable: The gray–blue outfit featured extremely wide peaked lapels and was covered in glowing pinstripes comprised of small golden studs

Winnie looked like a classic Hollywood bombshell in her sequin-covered purple gown.

The America's Next Top Model star's look featured a plunging top that highlighted her cleavage.

She wore her dark locks straight with undulating waves resting gracefully over her shoulder.

Winnie added some extra cover with a matching feathered shawl down around her arms, and she matched a pair of sparkling purple heels to the outfit.

Glamorous: Winnie looked like a classic Hollywood bombshell in her sequin-covered purple gown

Showing her assets: The America's Next Top Model star's look featured a plunging top that highlighted her cleavage

Also posing with Winnie was John Demsey, the executive group president of Estée Lauder, who looked dapper in a black suit with a scarlet tie and matching pocket square.

He was the evening's recipient of the Golden Heart Award for Outstanding Volunteerism and Community Leadership.

The award ceremony was presented by God's Love We Deliver, a charity organization that works to provide meals to and end hunger among people living with HIV/AIDS, as well as other serious illnesses.

Back in black: Also posing with Winnie was John Demsey, the executive group president of Estée Lauder, who looked dapper in a black suit with a scarlet tie and matching pocket square

Modeling icon Iman was also among the recipients, being awarded the Michael Kors Award for Outstanding Community Service.

She glowed in a copper-colored leopard-print suit with an open jacket exposing her low-cut sheet top that was dappled with sequins.

Her caramel-colored tresses were parted down the middle and hung in elegant curls, showcasing her large gold hoop earrings.

Vogue Editor–in–Chief Anna Wintour looked vibrant in a green and white leopard-print dress. She served as the honorary chairwoman for the ceremony.

Marisa Tomei looked chic in a floor-length scarlet dress styled like a double-breasted suit.

Sara Sampaio also wore a blazer, though she added some flair to it with sequins and feathered sleeves.

The short look put her long, trim legs on full display.

Co-chairs Neil Patrick Harris and David Burtka looked classy in complementary suits.

Neil was unmissable in his gray plaid suit with matching salt–and–pepper designer stubble.

His husband, actor and chef David Burtka, was dressed in an intriguing green corduroy suit with a plaid tie.

The spotlight was the Golden Heart Award for Outstanding Leadership and Public Service, which was awarded to Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg, mayor of South Bend, Indiana.
